intro: Psychotria herbacea, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround small white flowers, making it visually striking. It typically grows as an erect herb or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Psychotria herbacea is also known for its use in traditional medicine and its role in ecological systems as a food source for certain insect species.
